summary: This bill, the DC Criminal Reforms to Immediately Make Everyone Safe Act (DC CRIMES Act), focuses on juvenile justice in the District of Columbia. Key provisions include limiting youth offender status to individuals 18 and under, mandating the Attorney General to establish a public website with juvenile crime statistics, and prohibiting the D.C. Council from altering existing mandatory minimum sentences or sentencing guidelines. The Act aims to increase public transparency regarding juvenile crime and tighten sentencing regulations.
